Notes module¶

Overview¶

This section documents all parts of the Notes module in the Personal Assistant application.

Urls¶

Routes that define how the application maps URL paths to views.

URL configuration for the note_app module.

This module contains all the URL routes for the Notes feature of the Personal Assistant app. Each route maps a URL path to its corresponding view function.

Routes are grouped into: - Notes operations (create/edit/delete/view) - Tag operations (create/edit/delete/filter)

App name:

note_app

Example

Use with Django’s reverse() function:
>>> reverse("note_app:note-main")
note_app.urls.app_name

The application namespace.

Type:

str

note_app.urls.urlpatterns

List of URL route definitions.

Type:

list

note_app.urls.urlpatterns = [<URLPattern 'main/' [name='note-main']>, <URLPattern 'tag/' [name='note-tag']>, <URLPattern 'tag/<str:tag_name>' [name='notes-by-tag']>, <URLPattern 'tag/edit/<int:tag_id>/' [name='notes-tag-edit']>, <URLPattern 'tag/delete/<int:tag_id>/' [name='notes-tag-delete']>, <URLPattern 'note/' [name='note']>, <URLPattern 'note/edit/<int:note_id>/' [name='note-edit']>, <URLPattern 'note/color/<int:note_id>/' [name='note-color-update']>, <URLPattern 'note/delete/<int:note_id>/' [name='note-delete']>]

List of URL patterns for note and tag operations

Views¶

Business logic and presentation rendering for notes and tags.

redirect_to_error

Redirect to the generic error page with a custom message.

count_top_tags

Count and return top tags used by the user with dynamic font sizes.

get_notes_on_page

Get number of notes per page from GET parameter.

main

Display main notes dashboard with pagination, sorting and search support.

tag

Create new tag or show form for creating tag.

edit_tag

Edit existing tag belonging to current user.

note

Create or edit a note.

note_detail

View note details.

note_delete

Delete a note if it belongs to the current user.

search_by_tag

Search notes by tag for current user.

update_note_color

Update note color.

delete_tag

Delete a tag if not used in any notes.

Forms¶

Form definitions for user input handling.

TagForm¶

class note_app.forms.TagForm(data=None, files=None, auto_id='id_%s', prefix=None, initial=None, error_class=<class 'django.forms.utils.ErrorList'>, label_suffix=None, empty_permitted=False, instance=None, use_required_attribute=None, renderer=None)

Bases: ModelForm

Form for creating or updating a tag.

Fields:

  • name (CharField): The name of the tag. Required. Max length 50.

model

alias of Tag

NoteForm¶

class note_app.forms.NoteForm(data=None, files=None, auto_id='id_%s', prefix=None, initial=None, error_class=<class 'django.forms.utils.ErrorList'>, label_suffix=None, empty_permitted=False, instance=None, use_required_attribute=None, renderer=None)

Bases: ModelForm

Form for creating or editing a note.

Fields:

  • note_title (CharField): The title of the note. Required. Max length 500.

  • note (CharField): The content of the note. Optional. Max length 5000.

class Meta

Bases: object

exclude = ['tags', 'created', 'last_modified_at']
fields = ['note_title', 'note']
model

alias of Note

base_fields = {'note': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>, 'note_title': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>}
declared_fields = {'note': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>, 'note_title': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>}
property media

Return all media required to render the widgets on this form.

Data models¶

Models defining the structure of notes and tags.

Tag¶

class note_app.models.Tag(*args, **kwargs)

Bases: Model

Model representing a user-defined tag for notes.

name

Name of the tag (must be unique per user).

Type:

str

user

Reference to the user who owns the tag.

Type:

User

Meta:

constraints: Ensures that each tag name is unique per user.

__str__()

Returns a human-readable string representation of the tag.

id

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

name

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

note_set

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

objects = <django.db.models.manager.Manager object>
user

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

user_id

Note¶

class note_app.models.Note(*args, **kwargs)

Bases: Model

Model representing a personal note belonging to a user.

note_title

Title of the note.

Type:

str

note

Content of the note (optional).

Type:

str

created

Timestamp when the note was created.

Type:

datetime

last_modified_at

Timestamp of the last modification.

Type:

datetime

tags

Tags associated with this note.

Type:

ManyToMany[Tag]

user

Reference to the user who owns the note.

Type:

User

color

Background color of the note in HEX format.

Type:

str

Meta:

constraints: Ensures that each note title is unique per user.

__str__()

Returns the note title as its string representation.
